meanings.definition: To grade or evaluate incorrectly or inaccurately.
meanings.sent1: She kept misgrading the math tests, giving wrong scores to the students.
meanings.sent2: The teacher realized she was misgrading the assignments and quickly corrected her mistakes.
meanings.sent3: The misgrading of the spelling bee caused quite a stir among the participants.
meanings.sent4: His habit of misgrading people's efforts led to misunderstandings and hurt feelings.
meanings.sent5: Misgrading can have serious consequences, especially in academic settings.

meanings.definition: The act of incorrectly grading or evaluating something.
meanings.sent1: The misgrading of the exams resulted in confusion among the students.
meanings.sent2: He discovered a misgrading error in his report card and asked for a review.
meanings.sent3: The misgrading of the art competition made the judges reconsider their criteria.
meanings.sent4: Her reputation suffered due to the misgrading scandal that rocked the school.
meanings.sent5: Misgrading can lead to disputes and dissatisfaction among those affected.
